alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 1:12PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Keokuk, western Johnson, southern Benton, northwestern Washington, southwestern Linn and Iowa Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 111 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wellman to North English to What Cheer. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Millersburg around 115 PM CDT. Parnell around 120 PM CDT. Williamsburg around 130 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Oxford, Conroy, Ladora, Marengo, Amana, Belle Plaine, Walford, Victor, Blairstown, Norway, Luzerne and Fairfax. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 205 and 234. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington
